conversations.content: Yoshitsune has arrived at a graveyard in North Grastaea in order to speak with someone who has passed on.
I'm sorry I haven't visited recently.
My duties as a Wyrmclan leader have kept me very busy indeed.
But thanks to that, I have plenty to talk about. You always liked that, didn't you? Listening to me ramble on?
Yes, well... First I want to talk about the aspects of my past that I never told you.
Long, long ago, in the island nation of Hinomoto, numerous powers were in a state of constant war. During that time, I was born to a family of warriors who threw themselves headlong into the fray.
My father, being the superstitious type, gave myself and my elder brother the names of two famous warriors of old. My brother was called Yoritomo, and I Yoshitsune.
He must have hoped we would work together to accomplish great things, but alas, it was not to be...
The enemy forces' last stronghold is situated on the small island ahead, Lady Ushiwakamaru.
Do not call me by my childhood name. I have come of age, and will be known as Yoshitsune alone.
And now, we arrive at last to our finale. ...All heed! Launch your ships! To battle!
ALL HAIL YOSHITSUNE THE UNBREAKABLE!
I was known as a genius of battle in those days. My victories were legion, and soon my fame grew throughout all of Hinomoto.
I stood out. ...Too much, it seems.
Hrgh! You... You serve my brother! Why are you attacking me?!
I act on Lord Yoritomo's orders. The era of strife is near its end, and the age of governance upon us.
A government needs equality and harmony to function. Those possessed of too much strength make others wary, and could soon become a common enemy.
You possess great strength, my lady— so if your brother's new government is to succeed, you must die this day!
Aaaagh!
I sustained a serious wound in that surprise attack, and was carried away by my vassals.
As we fled, my vassals fell one by one, and by the time we made it to the mountains...
In a windy cave on a sacred mountain...
Benkei? What happened to Yoichi?
We ran into pursuers on the way back from scouting. He acted as a decoy, and...
Meaning you are the only vassal remaining to me... Nnngh!
Do your wounds trouble you, my lady?
Oh, they do indeed. My fever rages, and I have lost enough blood to coat an entire field. I fear this is my end.
It's not as if I expected to die warm in my own bed, but I had hoped to at least perish on the battlefield...
Enough of that. Where is the Yoshitsune of old—the one who admonished me  when I was filled with bloodlust upon a certain bridge?
Scold me as you will, Benkei; my death comes regardless.
There is one last thing to try, Lady Yoshitsune...
Here. Take this fresh water.
Water for the dying, is it? You have my thanks...
Nnngh... I feel...dizzy... The pain is everywhere.
Rest, my lady. When you wake, we will head for the fishing village to the northwest. I have prepared a boat.
Board it, and leave this land. Ride the current to North Grastaea, and your pursuers ought not be able to follow.
I...told you... This is where I...
If you die, my lady, it is all over. I...want you be happy.
Benkei...? Nnngh...
H-how long was I...?
What?! My wounds are healed! But how is this possible?!
And where is Benkei?!
Beyond the mouth of the cave, I found a veritable mountain of enemy bodies in front of Benkei, who was still standing even in death.
His body was pierced through with countless broken swords and arrows; he had fought to the very last to see me safe.
I am so sorry, Benkei...
And now I'm the only one left.
But I've got to keep going. On the boat he procured for me.
By the time I arrived in North Grastaea, the era of war in Hinomoto had ended, and the shogunate ruled over all.
Vexing though it was, my brother was right: The time of government had arrived.
But there's more to the story... At first, I had no idea how I had managed to claw back from the icy grip of death.
I would only learn the reason later, as a result of that incident that was as fateful to you as it was to me...
I brought treats from Hinomoto called ＂rakugan.＂ They're something of a standard offering for the departed.
You always did love your sweets, so I'm sure you will enjoy them.
Now where was I...? Ah, yes. I drifted to North Grastaea and found myself without food, which meant I needed work.
My only marketable skill was my ability in battle, so it was only natural that I became a wandering mercenary.
Several years after I drifted to North Grastaea...
We got fiends blocking the road! Turn back, now!
We can't! We're pinned in by the wagons behind us!
Looks like I'm up. Stay back. This will be dangerous.
Hey, you there! Out of the way! Wagon coming through! Haaaah!
We should be good to pass now.
What fortune that I hired you on as a bodyguard, Khan.
No need for thanks. It's my job.
That name Khan, which you know well, was  something I took on for work. I thought a person with a name styled like the locals would be more approachable, which would lead to more offers of work.
We'll make camp here for the day, Khan. Keep watch while we inspect the cargo.
Understood.
Forgive me, Captain, but might I be excused from inspection duty?
Huh? Oh, right. It's almost her feeding time. Well, you can keep watch with Khan while you do it, all right?
There there. Drink up, little one.
Goo goo...
Cute. She yours?
My baby sister. Our parents died right after she was born.
So you're raising her? That's decent of you.
Well, I don't FEEL decent. She keeps me up all night, and with all the caravan work, I sometimes find myself thinking of her as nothing but a...burden.
Don't be hard on yourself; everyone in your position has such negative thoughts from time to time. You are a good brother.
...Thank you, Khan.
Goo!
Hmm? What is it, Sis? You wanna play with that iron tube Khan is carrying?
You mean my tetsuhau? This is no toy, but a weapon. I'm afraid I can't lend her something dangerous like this.
Well now, that's a curious shape for a weapon. How do you use it?
I don't know. It's a treasured heirloom that has been passed down in my family for generations, but someone forgot to include instructions along the way.
I mostly use it to bash enemies in the face when my blade becomes dull.
Goo goo! Blech!
Heh. Looks like someone is grumpy because she can't fiddle with my deadly weapon. How about we play instead? Up, up, and awaaaay! Wheeee!
The next day, the caravan continued along the mountain road toward its destination— and I will forever regret that I didn't pay more attention...
I scouted ahead and found no sign of fiends.
We'll continue on, then. The road is quite narrow, so pass on the word to the wagons behind us to be careful.
WAAAAAAAH!
Easy there, Sis. What's wrong? Why so upset all of a sudden?
It's like she's afraid of something...
Rocks! Rocks coming off the cliff!
Oh, hell!
Hellooooo? Anyone alive? Yoooo-hoo! Let us know so we can end yer misery! Bwaaaa ha ha ha ha!
All right boys, start gatherin' anything what looks valuable and make sure to... Oy, look at this pretty lady here!
Stones crushed her flat. Shame, that.
But her sword's in fine shape, so take it— and snatch up that iron tube while yer at it!
Oy, hold up! Did she just move?
Cor, are ya mad? She smashed to paste! No way this one's drawin' breath.
...What the blazes?! She's healed!
I take it you're the curs who dropped those boulders on us.
I got no idea what the hell's happenin', but I killed ya once and I can do it again! Taaaaaake THIS!
Ha! Right in the sweet spot! See ya in hell, girlie.
If you're quite done, it's time for you to pay for your foul deeds.
Blimey, she's still kickin'! What kinda monster IS this lady?!
GRAAAAAAGH!
My wounds are already healing...
This was how I came to understand what was happening to my body.
If I lost an arm, it grew back. If I lost a leg, I soon had replacement. If my heart stopped, it would restart in moments. I was...immortal.
This one's gone, too... Looks like I'm the only survivor...
Wah... Wah...
Ah!
Waaaah...
Her brother shielded her with his body.
I knew you were a good one...
Easy, little one. Hello. I know that was scary, but you're all right now.
Goo...
Let's pay our respects to the dead and then head to town.
In the years after the attack on the caravan, I continued to work as a mercenary.
Out of my way!
The vaunted warrior does not disappoint! She broke through their lines by herself!
Ain't no way we could ever pull that off!
Who told you two it was break time? We've got a fort to capture, so MOVE!
Back then, I never faltered in battle—why would I, knowing I could not die? As a result, I led the way to victory in multiple conflicts, and soon found myself with ever more mercenary acquaintances.
Looks like everyone has a glass, so let us toast to victory!
TO VICTORY!
You're the reason this job was so easy, Khan, so good on ya! Bwa ha ha ha!
Oh, I saw plenty of mighty blows struck by the rest of you. But in any case, I hope we fight again together soon.
Khan's somethin' else... Strong, gutsy, beautiful... Think she's got a boyfriend?
Er, this is your first time working with Khan, isn't it?
Here's a tip: Quit while you're ahead.
Mama!
Hello, Marie. You want something to eat? Anything you like, my treat.
Wait, she's got a daughter?!
Out of obligation, yeah. Couple years back, a caravan she was guarding got waylaid, and that kid was the only other survivor. Afterward, she adopted her as her own.
A whole line'a suitors have tried their luck, but they all meet the same end as her enemies in battle. Seems that little cutie is the only love she needs in life.
Where'd you go this time, Mama?
Heh. You do love my stories.
Yeah! They're super fun, and you're SO cool in them!
Let's see, then. Where should I begin?
I'm sorry, but could you head home first, Marie? I need to get some air, but I promise I'll be along in short order.
Sure.
...You've been watching me since we were at the restaurant, so you might as well come out and save us both the hassle.
A pleasure to meet you, Lady Yoshitsune. I am an envoy of Lord Yoritomo.
Yoritomo?! Here to finish me, then?
No, my lady. I come only to inform you that Lord Yoritomo deeply regrets your past treatment and wishes to make amends.
Lies. My brother would never say such.
But it's true I feel no threat from you. So if you're not here for my head, what's REALLY going on?
Are you aware that Lord Yoritomo has become leader of the Rooster Wyrmclan, one of the twelve branch clans that hold claim to the leadership of the shogunate?
Yes. Our family is distantly related to the shogunal family, which is why we were selected to be one of its branch houses.
Each of these Wyrmclans has a leader who forms a pact with a dragon—but in doing so, their soul is diminished, along with their lifespan.
Lord Yoritomo has precious little time left. However, his heir, Lord Yoriie, is still quite young, and my lord worries governing will prove a challenging prospect for him.
Ah, now I see. He wants me to serve as an intermediary in the line of succession until my nephew is of age. How very selfish— and how so very like him.
Your lord brother is well aware of that. However, if you can bring together the Rooster Wyrmclan, would that not grant your fallen vassals peace?
What would you know about them?
A vassal wishes to see their master grow in distinction. And though the position may be temporary, you could become a shogun candidate—or even the shogun herself.
No matter how you distinguish yourself as a mercenary, you will always be a grunt. Were I one of your vassals, I would feel a death on your behalf to be meaningless.
Take what time you need to think this over. Think about why you were kept alive.
Morning, Mama! It's lovely weather today.
Good morning, Marie. I'm going to the blacksmith today, so be a good girl and watch over things here while I'm gone.
I will. Byeee!
(＂Why I was kept alive＂... What way of living, I wonder, would best serve as an offering to my fallen vassals...)
There you are! Er, I mean... Hey, Khan. Funny runnin' into you here.
Hello. Did you all come to have some weapon maintenance done as well?
Er, we...uhhh...
Just consulting on some equipment. He wanted to pick something good.
Oh, er, yeah. Would you mind helping me pick out some quality gear, Khan?
Sorry, but when the work is done on my blade, I have to head home.
C'mon, just help us a little!
Huh? Wait...
I can't believe I let those fools drag me into this and delay me for so long. I'll have to apologize to Marie...
I'm home, Marie! ...Marie?
Congratulations, Mama!
Marie? Daniela? What's going on with these decorations and all that food?
Ha! We did it! Operation Slow-Her-Down was a rousing success!
Gonzales...Messa...you're here, too... What's going on?
You really do think of nothing but battle... It's your BIRTHDAY! Remember?
Marie told us her plan during the banquet.
She wanted us to help throw a party.
And seeing how much we owe you for taking care of us on the battlefield, not a soul hesitated to jump in.
I don't know what to say...
I just wanted you to be happy, Mama. ...So how did I do?
You did amazing, child. I'm delighted.
...Then your mind is decided?
Yes. I'm staying in North Grastaea.
And giving up on the path of success? What would your vassals think?
Do you know what the last thing Benkei ever said to me was?
He said that he wanted me to be happy, That's the reason I was kept alive.
And what makes me happy are my family and comrades here in North Grastaea. Now please go, and give my regards to my brother and nephew.
...Very well.
Mama, c'mere!
On my way.
For a while after that, I had a warm, good life filled with the happiness I sought.
But in all that happiness, my mind never caught on to the heartbreak that awaits an undying woman. ...You know what I mean, Marie?
The gravestone Yoshitsune addresses is inscribed with the following:
Marie, Beloved Daughter of Khan  Rest in Peace, Little One
Forty years after that birthday celebration, Gonzales passed away surrounded by his many children.
Ten years later, Messa and Daniela— who had married—passed on at the same moment, each holding the other's hand.
And you...
You're the one who sent me the letter. You're Marie's...
Her granddaughter, yes. Grandmother talked about you all the time, Khan.
She said you were a wonderful person who raised her in place of her birth mother. But she also said she didn't see you again after she was married.
I was a flashy and successful mercenary, which attracted the ire of a fair number of business rivals. I pulled away in order to keep her from getting involved.
Is Marie sleeping?
Yes. She was muttering in her sleep that she wanted to see Mama, although she can't really tell who is who anymore.
I see. But I'm going inside regardless.
Nnngh... Wh-who's there?
It's me, little one. Khan. ...It's been a long time.
Kh...an?
You don't remember. Well, I suppose we have both earned our fair share of wrinkles, haven't we?
What if I do...this?
You...you're...
Surprising, isn't it? Yes, it got pretty hard to keep fighting in my old body.
A few years ago, deep in the mountains of Taiwu, a legendary qigong master taught me a secret technique to become young again—if only for a little while.
It's Mama... Mama is here... Welcome home, Mama...
Where'd you go...this time...Mama?
Heh. You do love my stories.
Yeah...they're super fun... and you're so cool...in them...
Let's see, then. Where should I begin?
Marie?
Sleep well, child.
People fear of death because they do not know what lies beyond. And yet, there is nothing more sorrowful and terrifying than watching an endless parade of loved ones move on without you.
This is why I finally decided to cast away my undying body.
I tried every method I could think of and met with failure each time. But just when I thought I would go mad, I suddenly remembered something...
Each of these Wyrmclans has a leader who forms a pact with a dragon—but in doing so, their soul is diminished, along with their lifespan.
Several years after Marie's passing Hinomoto—The Estate of the Rooster
How many decades had it been since I was last there? I suppose I could call it fortunate that the Rooster clan had no other successors.
Fortunately, Yoritomo's envoy from that day was still alive, and with his backing I managed to succeed the clan.
Thanks to that, I was able to swear a soulpact, but will it truly allow me to die, I wonder?
Lady Yoshitsune, a messenger from the Ox has come to offer greetings and congratulations on your selection as a Wyrmclan leader.
It is ever such a pleasure to make your acquaintance. I am Rikugo, a shikigami in service to the Ox wyrmclan.
My lord planned to come in person today, but as it happens, he has seen the recent birth of a grandchild—a sweet baby boy.
However, his daughter has experienced postpartum difficulties, so he appointed me to serve as his representative.
I apologize myself. Though I was most occupied with the succession, it still ought to have been me, as a new leader, that set out to offer greetings.
I will have a feast prepared. Pray stay and allow us to treat you by way of apology.
Please spare yourself the trouble. With my master's words delivered, I'm to return home immediat.... My! How mysterious.
What is it?
I feel a most inexplicable power from you, Lady Yoshitsune. It is the ominous power of Tsukuyomi. And it appears to be of life unending.
You know something of this?!
Hmm. It would appear you have a story. Please articulate the particulars to me.
...Ah, I see. It sounds as though your power over death comes from the water.
The water Benkei gave me?
That was no mere water; I think it likely you drank a miraculous elixir from Tsukuyomi known as ＂ochimizu.＂
Tsukuyomi? The dragon who lost to Amaterasu in ancient times? How could Benkei have had access to such a thing?
Of that, I know as little as you. Nonetheless, it is a matter most troublesome.
Per your position, you have forged the soulpact and should see your life shortened—and yet, the ochimizu sees that it is continually replenished.
Then I STILL cannot die?
The power of ochimizu is great—too great, even, for the prodigious power of onmyodo to sway your situation.
You will enjoy a long life despite having made a soulpact. For a Wyrmclan leader, this is the finest of things.
Yet if knowledge were to get out, the other Wyrmclan leaders would doubtless defect to Tsukuyomi's side in order to reap the benefits of the ochimizu.
In my estimation, it would be wise for you to keep word of your body and its resilience to yourself and not share it with the other Wyrmclan leaders.
Answer something for me: What is the relationship between the Wyrmclan leaders and Tsukuyomi?
As you left Hinomoto before the formation of the shogunate, it is no surprise that you would be ignorant of the situation.
Tsukuyomi disapproves of a shogunate ruling Hinomoto, and has banded together a group of rebels to plot its downfall. They call themselves the Mukuroshu.
As such, Amaterasu has issued a secret directive to the Wyrmclan leaders that they are to be exterminated.
In particular, my master—the leader of the Ox wyrmclan—has been tasked with hunting the Mukuroshu.
If Tsukuyomi's elixir made me this way, she might also possess the power to return me to a normal lifespan.
And if I go after the Mukuroshu, I'll likely find Tsukuyomi...
Would it be acceptable for me to hunt this group as well, Rikugo?
That would be extremely delightful and auspicious. I shall inform my lord at once.
You have my thanks.
I held no interest in Hinomoto's fate; I wished only to die a natural death.
And in order to make that happen, I was willing to use anything available to me. The Wyrmclans, the Mukuroshu...anything.
Twenty years after Yoshitsune became a Wyrmclan leader, shortly before her visit to South Grastaea...
Here is the letter from the shogunate, as requested.
Excellent. With this, our plans to bring down the shogunate can proceed apace.
I will be heading there myself shortly after. By the way, will Tsukuyomi really appear if the Realm of the Dead is opened?
If we obtain the power to surpass Amaterasu, there will no longer be any need for great Tsukuyomi to remain hidden.
Then I pray for your success.
Not that I care if the Mukuroshu's scheme goes without a hitch or the Wyrmclans manage to put a stop to it...
I pursued Tsukuyomi in my capacity as a clan leader, but at the same time, I fed information to the Mukuroshu.

If the Wyrmclan leaders managed to drag Tsukuyomi out into the open, that would be great, and if it looked like aiding the Mukuroshu was more likely to work, I was fine with betraying the Wyrmclans, too.
I would do anything so long as I could meet with Tsukuyomi and have her free me from my prison of undying flesh...
Lady Yoshitsune, an envoy from the Ox Wyrmclan is come.
Lead them here.
Greetings to you, Lady Yoshitsune.
It's been some time, Rikugo—or should I call you the Marvelous Naoto, famed enka singer? That truly is a remarkable stage name you've adopted.
And I have attained much favor and been in great demand everywhere as a result.
Which lets you travel to and fro collecting information. So what brings you here?
I have a souvenir for you, Lady Yoshitsune. This is information on an old weapon called a ＂manacaster,＂ which has leaked from the Radiant City Chanzelia.
This manacaster weapon sounds similar to my tetsuhau. Indeed, they may even be one and the same.
I thought it was just a stout black iron cylinder, but I am surprised to see that it actually fires projectiles.
If you perform maintenance on it using this information, I believe you could render the tetsuhau usable once more.
This is a fine souvenir indeed. I will have to thank you somehow.
In that case, I have a request.
Lady Yoshitsune, please guide my lord, Lord Seimei.
Rikugo? What's going on?
The mission Lord Seimei has been given pits him against the hateful slayer of my previous lord—a man named Doman.
Lord Seimei is behaving as he always does, but I am...frightened.
I worry he may throw his life away in an attempt to stop Doman.
And you want me to prevent this. Very well. I agree.
But if I may, trying to interfere when someone is determined to do a thing even at the cost of their life strikes me as a touch presumptuous.
I am well aware. Nonetheless, he is the grandson of my previous lord, and I see him as something akin to family.
All I want is for Lord Seimei to live on and be happy.
If you die, my lady, it is all over. I...want you be happy.
Survival is no guarantee of happiness.
Happiness is not something made by one person alone. Lord Seimei has Kuzunoha and Gozu Tenno, who both admire him beyond words.
A life with people who love you so is assured to be a happy one.
People who love you...
I'd seen so many people out of this life that I had completely forgotten that...
I forgot the happiness I knew BECAUSE I survived and lived on.
My goal is unchanged: I want to be rid of this immortality. But dying right now... Well, it might not be quite right.
When I was cast aside by my brother, I should have died a miserable death in that damp cave.
But because Benkei brought me back from the brink, I was able to experience the love I got from you and all the other people I met along the way.
If I don't pass on how valuable something like that is, I will have been brought back to this world for nothing.
So I've decided to teach the young man the beauty of being loved before I go.
I'm sorry to make you wait, little one, but please hold on a little longer.
